basics.name: Atharva Rahane
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a Master's in Mechanical Engineering at the Michigan Technological University. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2020.

education.institution: Savitribai Phule Pune University, Maharashtra, India

highlights: Developed a computational model using ANSYS for thermal analysis of multiple precision stamped electronic components
Prepared multiple simulation cases and studied the heat transmitted by the electronic components to the circuit board
Performed thermal analysis on a Butt welded joint with temperature dependent thermal properties varying from 300K to 2000K
Performed transient thermal analysis of cooling of ST-37 under natural convection with a heat transfer coeﬃcient of 13W/sq.m K

volunteer.summary: Cooling of High power Density Electronics
highlights: Contributed in a team to develop a cooling system for electronics, using micro-structured mesh and piezo electric transducers

Performed test section (ﬂow channel) and heater block simulations in conjunction with experimentally generated output to obtain the heat ﬂux and temperature distribution over the ﬂow channel using ANSYS FLUENT
Developed novel technology which has an increase in heat transfer eﬃciency by 700% and decrease in driving temperature diﬀerence by 80-90% compared to the conventional ﬂow-boiling approach

volunteer.summary: Thermal Management of Electric Vehicle Battery
highlights: Developed an eﬀective way to dissipate large amount of heat released from an electric vehicle battery during Ultra-Fast Charging (10-15 minutes for charging 50 KWh Li-Ion battery)
Designed a passive Cooling Cell using Phase Change Material(PCM) to maintain the battery cell temperature below 45◦C and temperature gradient across the battery cell below 5◦C
Performed multi-phase simulation using solidiﬁcation-liquefaction model to simulate melting of a phase change material and reduced the mushy zone using adaptive meshing technique

awards.title: B+ Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarships awarded to incoming freshmen and continuing students who complete a rigorous high school curriculum with a minimum overall GPA of 3.0 at a Hawai'i public school.

awards.title: First place
awards.summary: My team won first place in 2015.  See my portfolio site for more details.
